com.srch2.android.http.service

Interface StateResponseListener


  • public interface StateResponseListener
    This interface contains the callback methods for the control related RESTful requests of the SRCH2 search server: upon completion of the specific request, the corresponding callback method will be called passing the corresponding subclass of RestfulResponse. Each RestfulResponse subclass will always contain the HTTP status code and RESTful response literal as returned by the SRCH2 search server; these values can be returned by calling getRESTfulHTTPStatusCode() and getRESTfulResponseLiteral() on any of the RestfulResponse subclasses.

    Implementers of this class can either parse the RESTful response literal as returned by getRESTfulResponseLiteral() of the specific RestfulResponse subclass in order to manually inspect the response from SRCH2 search server; however, this RESTful response literal is also parsed in the construction of the each RestfulResponse subclass and the relevant values of the RESTful response literal can be accessed from the specific RestfulResponse subclass methods.

    While it is not necessary to implement this interface, it is strongly encouraged. Implementations of this interface can be registered by calling SRCH2Engine.setStateResponseListener(StateResponseListener stateResponseListener).

    All of the callback methods in this interface are executed off the Ui thread, so if any of the data is to be made visible to the user, it must be pushed to the Ui thread first. Starting any intensive execution from the implementation of these callbacks methods is highly discouraged as it could block subsequent tasks performed by the SRCH2Engine.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onDeleteRequestComplete(String indexName, DeleteResponse response)
      Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an deletion task, which occurs when either mIndexable.delete(...) or SRCH2Engine.deleteFromIndex(...) is called.
      void onGetRecordByIDComplete(String indexName, GetRecordResponse response)
      Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an record retrieval task, which occurs when either mIndexable.getRecordbyID(...) or SRCH2Engine.getRecordByIdFromIndex(...) is called.
      void onInfoRequestComplete(String indexName, InfoResponse response)
      Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an information task, which occurs when either mIndexable.info() or SRCH2Engine.getIndexInfo(String indexName) is called.
      void onInsertRequestComplete(String indexName, InsertResponse response)
      Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an insert task, which occurs when either mIndexable.insert(...) or SRCH2Engine.insertIntoIndex(...) is called.
      void onSRCH2ServiceReady(HashMap<String,InfoResponse> indexesToInfoResponseMap)
      Called after the SRCH2 search server comes online after the call to SRCH2.onStart(Context context) is made.
      void onUpdateRequestComplete(String indexName, UpdateResponse response)
      Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an update task, which occurs when either mIndexable.update(...) or SRCH2Engine.updateIndex(...) is called.

    • Method Detail

      • onInfoRequestComplete

        void onInfoRequestComplete(String indexName,
                         InfoResponse response)
        Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an information task, which occurs when either mIndexable.info() or SRCH2Engine.getIndexInfo(String indexName) is called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index that the information task was completed upon
        response - a representation of the returned index information

      • onInsertRequestComplete

        void onInsertRequestComplete(String indexName,
                           InsertResponse response)
        Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an insert task, which occurs when either mIndexable.insert(...) or SRCH2Engine.insertIntoIndex(...) is called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index that was inserted into
        response - a representation of the RESTful insert response

      • onUpdateRequestComplete

        void onUpdateRequestComplete(String indexName,
                           UpdateResponse response)
        Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an update task, which occurs when either mIndexable.update(...) or SRCH2Engine.updateIndex(...) is called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index that was updated
        response - a representation of the RESTful update response

      • onSRCH2ServiceReady

        void onSRCH2ServiceReady(HashMap<String,InfoResponse> indexesToInfoResponseMap)
        Called after the SRCH2 search server comes online after the call to SRCH2.onStart(Context context) is made. When this method executes, it will pass a map of indexes ready for CRUD operations, defined by the Indexable implementations: this map contains the names of the indexes (as they were defined in the IndexDescription returned from the Indexable implementation of the method getIndexDescription()) as its keys mapping to the InfoResponse for each index.
        Parameters:
        indexesToInfoResponseMap - a mapping of indexes to their valid InfoResponses

      • onDeleteRequestComplete

        void onDeleteRequestComplete(String indexName,
                           DeleteResponse response)
        Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an deletion task, which occurs when either mIndexable.delete(...) or SRCH2Engine.deleteFromIndex(...) is called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index that had deletions
        response - a representation of the RESTful deletion response

      • onGetRecordByIDComplete

        void onGetRecordByIDComplete(String indexName,
                           GetRecordResponse response)
        Called after the SRCH2 search server completes an record retrieval task, which occurs when either mIndexable.getRecordbyID(...) or SRCH2Engine.getRecordByIdFromIndex(...) is called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index that the record requested was retreived from
        response - a representation of the RESTful record retrieval response, including the record retrieved if found
